Package edu.purdue.cs.percolator.util

Class SetupUtilities

The SetupUtilities class contains useful tools for setting up test suites.

  • Method Details

    • getPackageToTest

      public static String getPackageToTest()
      Returns the package to test. This is determined by the env system property.

      If the env property is set to dev, the solution package, defined by the solution.package.name system property, is returned, followed by a terminating period. If the solution.package.name property is not set, the method returns solution., including the terminating period.

      If the env property is set to prod or anything but dev, the student package, defined by the student.package.name system property, is returned, followed by a terminating period. If the student.package.name property is not set, the method returns an empty string, signifying the default package.

      This method's main purpose is to determine the package name for the classes you are testing when writing tests that use java.lang.reflect.

      Example:

      If your students are uploading Java code that rests in the default package (i.e., there is no package statement in the file), then you do not need to do anything. If your students are uploading Java code that is inside of a package, set the student.package.name to the entire package name, not including a terminating period. If you want to test your solution, set the env property to dev and set the solution.package.name property to the package name of your solution.

      Returns:
      the name of the package to test
